I'm using setTextRotation(90) on some columns and then setAutoSize, but when doing this setAutoSize calculates the column size like it weren't rotated. Happens in Writer Excel 2007 and Writer Excel 5
WorkItem.Summary: setAutoSize not taking into account text rotation

Comments.Message:
For a start, as for the math, check attached screen shot. Rotated width must depend on rotation angle (alpha), normal cell width (x) and font size (y):
rotated-width = x * cos(alpha) + y * sin(alpha)

There are some units and signs to watch out for.
Yup, looks like this is the way to do it! Did some further enhancements for stacked text plus some corrections for units and for negative rotation angles.
